intro: Phlebophyllum versicolor, commonly known as the variable liverwort, is a non-vascular plant belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is characterized by its leafy structure and the presence of rhizoids, which anchor it to surfaces. The plant exhibits a range of colors, from green to reddish-brown, depending on environmental conditions. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found on rocks or soil in temperate regions. Its morphology and color variation make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
